subTopicTitle: The divisions of the nervous system

items.prompt: Define the central nervous system (CNS) and its main components.
keyPoints: The CNS consists of the brain and spinal cord
The brain is responsible for processing and integrating information
The spinal cord relays information to and from the brain and the rest of the body

markingCriteria.full: Includes all key points with accurate detail
markingCriteria.partial: Includes 1-2 key points or lacks detail

items.prompt: What are the main functions of the peripheral nervous system (PNS)?
keyPoints: The PNS connects the CNS to the rest of the body
It is divided into the somatic and autonomic nervous systems
The somatic system controls voluntary movements
The autonomic system regulates involuntary bodily functions

markingCriteria.full: Includes all key points with accurate detail
markingCriteria.partial: Includes 1-2 key points or lacks detail

items.prompt: Describe the autonomic nervous system (ANS) and its subdivisions.
keyPoints: The ANS controls involuntary actions
It is subdivided into the sympathetic and parasympathetic nervous systems
The sympathetic system prepares the body for 'fight or flight'
The parasympathetic system promotes 'rest and digest' functions

markingCriteria.full: Includes all key points with accurate detail
markingCriteria.partial: Includes 1-2 key points or lacks detail

items.prompt: A student is about to give a public presentation. Explain how their nervous system is likely to respond.
keyPoints: The sympathetic nervous system will activate due to stress
Increased heart rate and breathing rate
Release of adrenaline
Pupil dilation for better vision
The parasympathetic system will calm the body post-presentation

markingCriteria.full: Accurate application of nervous system functions to the scenario
markingCriteria.partial: Some application but missing key details or inaccuracies present
markingCriteria.none: Inaccurate or no application to the scenario

items.prompt: How would the nervous system react to touching a hot surface?
keyPoints: The somatic nervous system would detect the heat through sensory neurons
A reflex arc would cause a quick withdrawal response
The CNS processes the information and sends a signal via motor neurons
The autonomic nervous system may also respond with increased heart rate

markingCriteria.full: Accurate application of nervous system components and processes
markingCriteria.partial: Some processes mentioned but missing key details
markingCriteria.none: Inaccurate or no relevant processes mentioned

items.prompt: Imagine a scenario where a person is relaxed after a meal. Explain the role of their nervous system.
keyPoints: The parasympathetic nervous system is active
Decreased heart rate and blood pressure
Stimulation of digestion and energy storage
Relaxation of muscles

markingCriteria.full: Correct application of the parasympathetic system's functions
markingCriteria.partial: Partial or unclear application of functions
markingCriteria.none: Incorrect or no application of relevant functions

items.prompt: Evaluate the reductionist nature of explaining behavior solely through the nervous system.
keyPoints: Reductionism simplifies complex human behavior to biological processes
It overlooks psychological, social, and environmental factors
Useful for understanding basic biological mechanisms
May neglect holistic understanding of behavior

markingCriteria.full: Balanced evaluation with clear PEEL structure
markingCriteria.partial: Some evaluation but lacks depth or structure
markingCriteria.none: No evaluative points or lacks structure

items.prompt: Discuss the limitations of using animal studies to understand the human nervous system.
keyPoints: Animal studies provide controlled environments
Ethical concerns about animal welfare
Differences between animal and human nervous systems
Findings may not fully generalize to humans

markingCriteria.full: Comprehensive evaluation with clear PEEL structure
markingCriteria.partial: Some evaluative points but lacks depth or clarity
markingCriteria.none: No evaluative points or lacks structure

items.prompt: Evaluate the role of the autonomic nervous system in stress responses.
keyPoints: ANS plays a critical role in 'fight or flight' responses
Sympathetic activation prepares the body for stress
Parasympathetic system restores calm
May not account for individual differences in stress responses

markingCriteria.full: Thorough evaluation with clear PEEL structure
markingCriteria.partial: Includes some evaluation but lacks depth or structure
markingCriteria.none: No evaluative points or lacks structure
